Html:
Hi all,

I've already define a Grammar using Irony, right now i open documents using Visual Studio and my LanguageService Highlights code and have intellisense for keywords, but i would like to show in the editor of visual studio sintax errors. For example, when i miss a ";" i would like the editor shows the error. For this i need 2 things: How to recover parse error from irony and how to show the error in visual studio editor.

Regards,

I'm not an expert on VS language integration, read this:
http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/33250/Writing-Your-First-Visual-Studio-Language-Service
note that it uses much old version of Irony, so sources should be adjusted
Also note that to get errors you should make Irony parser return parse tree even if there are errors - for this, you need to define error rules (recovery rules) in your grammar.
